top_categories.workout_context: Castellon Gravel Race rewards athletes who can hold sustained power without blowing up — threshold is the engine that drives everything above Zone 2.
Castellon Gravel Race’s spanish rolling, european gravel demands rapid power changes — surge over obstacles, settle on smoother sections, repeat for hours.
Racing Castellon Gravel Race isn’t just fitness — it’s pacing, fueling, and executing when conditions deteriorate. This workout practices the race itself.
The G-Spot zone (88–92% FTP) is where you’ll spend the hardest sustained miles of Castellon Gravel Race. Make this intensity feel like home.
Castellon Gravel Race’s spanish rolling gravel drains energy reserves faster than the distance suggests — durability training bridges the gap.
Over-unders train the lactate clearance you’ll need at Castellon Gravel Race when surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding hard.
Castellon Gravel Race’s spanish rolling gravel and competitive field demand explosive aerobic capacity — the ability to respond to surges without blowing up.
Critical power determines how long you can sustain above-threshold efforts at Castellon Gravel Race — a higher CP means more time in the red before failure.
The Norwegian double-threshold method builds the sustained power base for Castellon Gravel Race — massive training stimulus without the recovery cost of VO2max work.
Blended sessions combine endurance with intensity spikes — exactly what Castellon Gravel Race’s spanish rolling gravel delivers on race day.
Castellon Gravel Race’s 5,000ft of climbing demands seated and standing versatility — the ability to change climbing style as gradient and fatigue dictate.
Short, violent efforts are unavoidable at Castellon Gravel Race — climbs demanding 2-minute maximal efforts, surges to close gaps, attacks on spanish rolling gravel.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 40–60g carbs/hour for Castellon Gravel Race’s 75 miles. Front-load calories in the first half. One bottle per hour minimum, more in heat.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Castellon Gravel Race requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on spanish rolling gravel to build confidence. Expect: spanish rolling, european gravel, regional event.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on TT Threshold, Gravel Specific, and Race Simulation to prepare you for 75 miles of spanish rolling gravel in Castellon, Spain.
